xldoc.title: Varieties of Philosophical Analysis
xldoc.description: Some notes on the history of philosophical analysis

section.title: Overview
section.abstract: Sketches of various kinds of analysis which have been employed or advocated by Philosophers.

ul.li: concepts definable and principles derivable from logical concepts and principles

subsec.title: Mathematics Only
subsec.p: logicism is an initial triumph of analysis applied to mathematics using Frege's new logic

subsec.title: Begriffschrift
subsec.p: the greatest advance in logic since Aristotle, finally delivers a formal logic adequate for the derivation of mathematics

subsec.title: definability
subsec.p: mathematical concepts are shown to be definable in term of a small number of logical and set theoretic concepts

subsec.title: derivability
subsec.p: the theorems of mathematics are shown to be derivable by a fixed set of rules from a small number of logical and set theoretic axioms

subsec.title: analysis
subsec.p: is reductionist in logical and ontological terms

subsec.title: loose ends
subsec.p: arise from reservations about the logical status of ontological principles and from the essential incompleteness of formalisations of arithmetic, shown later by Gödel
